meanings.definition: To move to a new place or position.
meanings.sent1: The family relocates to a bigger house.
meanings.sent2: She relocates her desk to the corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel relocates its nuts to a secret hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The sun relocates its warmth from the morning to the afternoon.
meanings.sent5: The migrating birds relocate to warmer regions for the winter.

meanings.definition: To transfer to a different location.
meanings.sent1: The company relocates its headquarters to a new city.
meanings.sent2: He relocates the files from one folder to another.
meanings.sent3: The magician relocates the coin from his hand to his pocket.
meanings.sent4: The wind relocates the fallen leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The ants relocate their colony to a safer place underground.
